page.title: 14Child Recreation in Debenham
page.content: Debenham Youth Club offers computer facilities,discos and sporting activities.In 1985 there was a "Club Week"to raise money for Bangladesh as part of the U.N.International Youth Year.The district youth worker,Mr Burton,also runs a summer playscheme for younger children. Both the United Reformed and Parish Churches run Sunday Schools.Recently, two social clubs for youngsters have been formed jointly by these churches. The Anchor Boys,Boys Brigade and Boys Brigade Youth are flourishing. The Guide Company and Brownie Pack are popular.In April 1985 the Brownies reported a five-month waiting list. There is a gymnastics group,a dancing class and a Young Farmers group.Discos and Christmas parties are held at the Community Centre.Both schools run extra-curricular activities.
